pros:
-An organization that cares about their employees, with policies to back it up.
-Great vacation (4 weeks to start for everyone, 5 weeks after 2 years, etc.), + 3 personal days. And you're encouraged to take your vacation!
-Great benefits - you have a wallet, and you decide how you spend it (no "80% up to $200 on vision" garbage). If you want to spend it on vision, therapy, RMTs, whatever...you can.
-Organization values flexibility and support employees with flexible work arrangements.
-Motivated staff.
-A fun place to work - people are generally inclusive, friendly, and believe strongly in the social mission.
cons:
-Pay is low, and can be unsustainable for some living in Toronto (particularly if you have a family).
-High workload for some positions is unsustainable (particularly management and senior leadership).
-Size of the organization in Canada means that career path is limited for many working in HQ wishing to stay in Canada. In spite of this, it is a great place to gain experience and develop skills although might not be ideal for all for the long-haul due to limitations in career trajectory.
